message.content: Yes, the authors specify the training details for their experiments. In Appendix I of the paper, they provide the necessary hyperparameters and training details for the PARKING expert agent, skill-discovery CompILE modules for both PARKING and WRITING tasks, and synthetic students for PARKING. Moreover, they discuss environment pre-processing in Appendix H, modifications they made to simplify their user study in Appendix J, and provide details for the user study interface and survey questions. This makes it possible for readers to understand and potentially replicate their experiments.

Yes, the authors specify all the training details, including data splits, hyperparameters, and how they were chosen. In the experiments section, they detail the two motor control tasks (PARKING and WRITING), how they create drills, and the user study setup. In the appendix, they provide information about the pre-processing of environments, hyperparameters and training details for the PARKING expert agent, skill-discovery CompILE modules for both tasks, and synthetic students. Furthermore, they mention the user study recruitment, setup, interfaces, and post-study survey details. The details provided in the paper allow for replication and a clear understanding of their approach.

Yes, the authors specify all the training details in the paper and its appendix. They provide information on data splits, hyperparameters, and the training process for the PARKING expert agent, skill-discovery CompILE modules for both PARKING and WRITING tasks, and synthetic students for PARKING. Additionally, they mention the hardware used for training and the longest training time required. This level of detail allows for replicability and understanding of the experiments carried out in the study.
